member.summary: Updates PollingState from Location header.
member.param: Headers that will be added to request
Http method of the initial long running operation request

member.summary: Updates PollingState from GET operations.
member.param: Headers that will be added to request

member.summary: Updates PollingState from Azure-AsyncOperation header.
member.param: Headers that will be added to request

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureClientExtensions.GetUpdatedPollingStatus``2(Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureAsyncOperation,Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse{Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject,Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JObject},Microsoft.Rest.Azure.PollingState{``0,``1},System.String,System.Net.Http.HttpMethod)
member.summary:
The primary purpose for this function is to get status and if there is any error Update error information to pollingState.Error and pollingState.Exception
We have on a very high level two cases 1) Regardless what kind of LRO operation it is (AzureAsync, locaiton header) either we get error or we dont 2) If we get error object, this function expects that information in the form of AzureAsyncOperation model type 3) We get status and error information from AzureAsyncOperation modele and update PollingState accordingly. 3) If AzureAsyncOperation is null, we assume there was no error retruned in the response 4) And we get the status from provisioningState and update pollingState accordinly

member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureAsyncOperation
member.summary: The response body contains the status of the specified asynchronous operation, indicating whether it has succeeded, is in progress, or has failed. Note that this status is distinct from the HTTP status code returned for the Get Operation Status operation itself. If the asynchronous operation succeeded, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the successful request. If the asynchronous operation failed, the response body includes the HTTP status code for the failed request, and also includes error information regarding the failure.

member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2
member.summary: Base class for driving Azure LRO operation

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.#ctor(Microsoft.Rest.Azure.IAzureClient,Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse{`0,`1},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Constructor for creating Azure LRO LRO starts after the first response is returned to Azure ClientRuntime. This will validate the initial response for missing data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.BeginLROAsync
member.summary: Begin polling This will drive the entire LRO process of polling and checking for error during LRO

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.GetLROResults
member.summary: Return results from LRO operation

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.CheckFinalErrors
member.summary: Check for errors at the end of LRO operation Last chance to check any final errors

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.ValidateInitialResponse
member.summary: Does basic validation on initial response from RP, prior to start LRO process

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.InitializeAsyncHeadersToUse
member.summary: Initialize pollingUrl to use depending upon the headers passed back from RP This function will be called after each response received during LRO Each REST verb will override for specific requirements

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.StartPollingAsync
member.summary: Performs polling Workflow: Depends on an internal structure CurrentPollingState for driving the LRO operation 1) Depending upon the initial response status (starts/exits polling) 2) Reson for making Poll function part of CurrentPollingState because there can be scenario we might have to enabled to serialize polling state (user can save and drive polling operation) 3) Update polling state after each polling iteration 4) Check for errors on each reponse we recieve during LRO 5) Initialize polling URL to use based on the headers received in each polling response

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.UpdatePollingState
member.summary: Updates polling state strcture

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.IsCheckingProvisioningStateApplicable
member.summary: Each verb will override to define if checking provisioning state is applicable
member.returns: true: if it's applicable, false: if not applicable

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.PostPollingAsync
member.summary: Each verb will override depending upon the requirements

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.CheckForErrors
member.summary: Check for error codition during LRO Each verb can participate in deciding if certain response results in error

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.GetValidAbsoluteUri(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Validate passed URL
member.param: True: throws expception, False: does not throw exception

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.GetAzureAsyncResponseState
member.summary:
Get Valid status There are cases where there is an error sent from the service and in that case, the status should be one of the valid FailedStatuses But there are cases where there is a customized error sent by service and they do not fall under Failed/Success statuses, in that case we fall back on response status
e.g. The response status is OK, but the error body has the status as "TestFailed" (which do not fall under valid failed status, so we fall back to OK)

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.IsAzureAsyncOperationResponseStateValid
member.summary: This function determines if you are running your polling under Azure-Async header or if the response status falls under terminal/failed status

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.AzureLRO`2.IsUriEqual(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Check URI for equality including differences in trailing slash and compare case insensitive

member.summary: Base interface for LRO operations

member.summary: Base interface for Azure LRO operation classes

member.summary: Function that will begin the LRO operation

member.summary: Returns LRO operation result

member.summary: Ability for operatoins to participate in Error Status checking during polling This provides ability for certain operations to continue with legacy behavior

member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.DeleteLro`2
member.summary: DELETE Azure LRO Operation

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.DeleteLro`2.RESTOperationVerb
member.summary: REST Operation Verb

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.DeleteLro`2.#ctor(Microsoft.Rest.Azure.IAzureClient,Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse{`0,`1},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initializes DELETE LRO Operation

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.DeleteLro`2.InitializeAsyncHeadersToUse
member.summary:
For DELETE In absence of Async-operation, fall back on location header
If both (Async-Operation, LocationHeader) provided, we will use Async-Operation for driving LRO Will perform final GET on the provided LocationHeader to get calculation results.
If first response status code is 201 and location header is not provided, we throw
if first response status code is 202, we prefer Async-operation, else we will use Location header

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.DeleteLro`2.IsCheckingProvisioningStateApplicable
member.summary:
Is checking provisioning state applicable for DELTE during LRO operation If response code is 200/204 (regardless of header and first response code)
This does not mean that for 200/204 the response WILL have provisioning state This function only says to check provisioning state that is all.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.DeleteLro`2.PostPollingAsync
member.summary:
If Azure Async-Operation URL is being used to poll and if the final response or any response returned Location header We assume a final GET has to be done on provided location header
This funciton allows to make any tweaks to the final GET if applicable In this case, using Location header to do the final GET

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.DeleteLro`2.IgnoreResponseStatus(System.Net.Http.HttpResponseMessage)
member.summary: Flag if NotFound status should be ignored during DELETE polling Enable legacy behavior for certain RPs that are sending resource URI as part of location

member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.PATCHLro`2
member.summary: PATCH Azure LRO operation

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.PATCHLro`2.RESTOperationVerb
member.summary: REST Operation Verb

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.PATCHLro`2.#ctor(Microsoft.Rest.Azure.IAzureClient,Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse{`0,`1},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initializes PATCH LRO Operation

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.PATCHLro`2.InitializeAsyncHeadersToUse
member.summary:
Initialize which URL to use for polling
First responose status code 201 Either we use Async-operatino header for polling Or fall back on original URL to poll
First response status code 202 We prefer Async-operation or we will fall back on location header
At the end of the polling we will use the original URL to do the final GET

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.PATCHLro`2.IsCheckingProvisioningStateApplicable
member.summary: Function to check if checking provisioning state is applicable during polling

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.PATCHLro`2.PostPollingAsync
member.summary: Function that allows you to make tweaks before finishing LRO operation and return back to the client

member.name: T:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.POSTLro`2
member.summary: POST Azure LRO operation

member.name: P:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.POSTLro`2.RESTOperationVerb
member.summary: REST Operation Verb

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.POSTLro`2.#ctor(Microsoft.Rest.Azure.IAzureClient,Microsoft.Rest.Azure.AzureOperationResponse{`0,`1},System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,System.Collections.Generic.List{System.String}},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Initializes POST LRO Operation

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.POSTLro`2.InitializeAsyncHeadersToUse
member.summary:
First response status is 201 Location header is required and we will throw if not provided
First response status is 202 We prefer Async-Operation, if not provided we will fall back on Location header
If we get both headers, we will use Location header to do the final GET at the end of the LRO operation

member.summary: Check if Provisioning state needs to be checked

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.POSTLro`2.PostPollingAsync
member.summary: Function that allows you to make tweaks before finishing LRO operation and return back to the client

member.name: M:Microsoft.Rest.ClientRuntime.Azure.LRO.PutLRO`2.InitializeAsyncHeadersToUse
member.summary: Initialize with the right URI to use for polling LRO opertion Depending upon the return status code and the header provided, we initialize PollingUrlToUse with the right URI Also verify if the right headers are provided, if not throw validation exception
